info.name: Derro race from Tome of Heroes
info.author: Kobold Press

description.p: Deep beneath the earth, the derro wait in twisted cities built by their mad architects. These insane humanoids live, work, and somehow thrive in the lightless depths. They understand the truth about the uncaring gods that dwell between the stars, and they abandoned sanity long ago to save themselves. The derro hide within their insanity in the hope that the dark gods they fear will turn that sinister attention to other, saner races first.

Despite the great distances between their underground cities and the surface, derro outposts can be found in the slums of many cities, both above and below ground. Occasionally, a derro discovers the wider world and finds a path out of the madness.

The derro are stunted, dwarflike humanoids, small of stature with wide shoulders and stubby limbs. They stand between 3 and 4 feet tall, with males only slighter taller than females on average. Their slender builds rarely weigh more than 40 pounds. Their pale skin is nearly translucent, revealing a ghostly web of blue veins. Their large, pure white staring eyes gleam in the dark.

Shorter than surface dwarves, derro are quick and erratic in their movements. Their elaborately braided or styled hair ranges from white to a pale straw color. Males take great pride in their prodigious mustaches, which are often braided and waxed.

The true history of the derro is an incomprehensible tangle. The entire race embraced insanity long ago. Even when they keep records, their accounts conflict with each other and with observable reality. The various cults and clans of the derro embrace a wide variety of myths, mostly passed along by oral tradition and mind-bending artwork. Every new teller of a given tale twists or rewrites portions of the story to fit their own warped view of the world.

The derro have existed for ages, perhaps thriving even before the spread of humans across the surface. The more reliable histories of other races agree the derro were once allied with the drow. The drow regard them with a strange type of favor, almost like dim-witted children. The aboleths and duergar have historically used and abused the derro. The derro know no actual friends, but they are overawed by power and dominance. They serve beings whose assumed superiority impresses them, and, when led in this way, their insanity clears enough to keep them moving toward the leader’s goals.

Love, as other races know it, is unheard of in the bizarre core family unit of the derro. Derro children are born sane, but they are deliberately driven mad by their relatives, usually by age four. Parents feed, clothe, and protect their children not out of a sense of love or tenderness, but because they know that every derro awakened to the mind-bending truth of their race brings them glory. The horrific rituals that break a young derro’s sanity vary by tribe and even year to year. Details are sparse, but known ritual names include Staring into the Void, Enduring the Heartless Fire, and the First Drink of True Knowledge.

Derro are paranoid, unstable, and jittery, and many suffer powerful delusions of grandeur as well. Madness compels them to commit acts of cruelty against their companions or pets, and these acts ignite constant infighting among them. A few, however, muster enough restraint and control to keep the entirety of derro society from crumbling.

Savants are powerful sorcerers who hold their madness at bay long enough to cobble together coherent plans, though even they are dangerously unpredictable. The derro’s antipaladins are terrifying engines of crazed destruction who have looked deep into the void between stars and survived — and even the savants respect them for that. Clans that stick together long enough inadvertently create a witch queen among their ranks, a collective spirit of the clan. These derro become the leaders and central focuses of their clans, driving the clan to inscrutable ends. When one witch queen dies, her spirit transfers to another derro in the clan, transforming that derro into the next witch queen and perpetuating the clan.

The derro worship a horde of bizarre and terrible beings, including demon lords. Perhaps the most disturbing of their deities are the Great Old Ones whose mere symbolic presence melts minds and corrupts the world. Derro worshipers venerate Nyarlathotep and Shub-Niggurath, the Black Goat of the Woods, in particular. There is no pattern or reason that governs which dark being will catch a given derro’s fancy, and devotees are violently hostile to worshipers of other entities.

Derro consider themselves the most exalted servants of the blasphemous figures they venerate; the only beings in the entire multiverse who can truly understand their deity’s glory. Specific rituals vary from cult to cult, but the unifying thread of derro faith asserts that their racial madness is a gift that makes communion with these deities possible. Further, the derro believe they are the harbingers of the end of time and that they alone will inherit the shattered husk of creation.

Names are thrust upon derro children haphazardly and with no clear general customs. Derro who worship an ancestor god might give their children a variation on the exalted figure’s name or title, or a child might grow almost to maturity before any adult bothers to call them by the same jumble of sounds twice. Clan, tribe, and family names also lack any discernable pattern, though occasionally they form a coherent description.

Male Adult Names:Akrath, Avrik, Brosh’Kal, Byrgryg, Crok’Til, Cyzyk, Daagrath, Durvin, Farq’shul, Folvig, Gaargrth, Grolesh, Haaskrin, Hvorig, Korzh, Lormaq, Orvuld, Ostvyrk, Perk’rasz, Pulver’Kash, Quirth, Qvaalak, Saasqar, Vorqaar
Female Adult Names:Aazha, Artriss, Bruen, Bylir, Dal’lyn, Drussil, Ealla, Erkytl, Grunhaas, Gvarla, Heldraag, Hylala, Muerna, Mzish, Ophella, Ortys, Rushal, Synder, Thryka, Tonlix, Ulga, Veraka, Vilya, Wulfada, Xanka
Tribe Names:Aardsyn, Blackreach, Balerock, Crystaaq, Daash’Void, Guundhold, Hellsreach, Iirdvank, Laash’Kath, Moldheim, Nyar’Ryk, Ovildhaash, Rylstaaq, Slys’Kath, Xaalyf
Your derro character has certain characteristics in common with all other derro.
Ability Score Increase. Your Dexterity score increases by 2.
Age. Derro reach maturity by the age of 15 and live to be around 75.
Alignment. The derro’s naturally unhinged minds are nearly always chaotic, and many, but not all, are evil.
Size. Derro stand between 3 and 4 feet tall with slender limbs and wide shoulders. Your size is Small.
Speed. Derro are fast for their size. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Superior Darkvision. Accustomed to life underground, you can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Eldritch Resilience. You have advantage on Constitution saving throws against spells.

Sunlight Sensitivity. You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.
Languages. You can speak, read, and write Dwarvish and your choice of Common or Undercommon.
Subrace. Three subraces of derro exist: far-touched, mutated, and uncorrupted. Choose one of these subraces.

description.p: Derro are unpredictable, fanciful, and prone to delusions, confusions, and manias. So how can they function in groups more accustomed to the stability of humans, dwarves, and elves?

In truth, the derro are less violent and more peculiar in a quieter way than their common portrayal as rabid maniacs. They are as likely to be brooding, depressed, or sullen as crazed and violent. Your derro character could have a tendency to talk to themselves, might address an invisible friend before undertaking any major step, or might simply consider all the other members of the party as “imaginary friends” and thus not subject to harassment.

Treat the derro’s madness as an occasional bit of flavor for the character, rather than an excuse to cripple the party with chaotic and self-defeating actions. A derro character won’t be as predictable as a dwarf paladin or a half-elf bard, but the derro might occasionally talk to rocks and interrogate mushrooms. Review the Minor Madnesses section on page 22 for examples of playable and flavorful maladies that afflict your character. Choose an appropriate minor madness or roll percentile dice to randomly determine it. Your character should have at least one minor madness, but check with your GM to confirm how many and which minor madnesses are most appropriate in your campaign.

To avoid derailing the party constantly, your character can have long lucid periods and might even regret actions taken when “turned to the dark void” or “ridden by the bat spirits” or a similar explanation. A derro in this lucid state could be a tragic character, always wondering when something will set off another bout of irrational raving. Keep in mind, derro are often awed by beings they see as powerful, though each derro defines what they deem as “powerful.” Your derro character could view another member of the group as the group’s “witch queen” (regardless of that character’s gender) and follow that character almost zealously. The instability of the derro could also lead your character to choose a different member of the group each day or each week as the current “witch queen.”

Playing a derro character involves making a fantasy form of otherworldly madness both playable and plausible. Find a way to make your character memorable without bogging down play or spoiling everyone else’s game.
Your character should have at least one minor madness, but check with your GM to confirm how many and which minor madnesses are most appropriate in your campaign.
You are a mad collector.
You eat things others would usually consider inedible.
You see or believe something that is not true or real.
You hold an intense prejudice towards a specific kind of creature for reasons known only to you.

element.name: 51-60 : Taboo (Cannot touch or interact with creature)

description.p: You cannot touch or interact with a specific type of creature.

select.name: Taboo (cannot touch or interact with creature)

description.p: You have a strong, irrational fear of a specific type of creature.
You have an unhealthy obsession with a specific type of creature.
Your madness manifests in a physical effect.
Choose Rocks or crystals.

Your character has an imaginary friend, god or spirit that is friendly and encouraging towards them. You and your DM can define the various traits and personality quirks of this entity. Add them to your character Notes.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Minor Delusion: Imaginary Friend
sheet.description: Your character has an imaginary friend, god or spirit that is friendly and encouraging towards them.

element.name: 11-20 : Has imaginary friend; god/spirit who is hateful and discouraging

description.p: Your character has an imaginary friend, god or spirit that is hateful and discouraging towards them. You and your DM can define the various traits and personality quirks of this entity. Add them to your character Notes.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Minor Delusion: Imaginary Friend
sheet.description: Your character has an imaginary friend, god or spirit that is hateful and discouraging towards them.

element.name: 21-30 : Is a high noble of derro society

description.p: You are of noble birth, a highborn of derro society, and above all others of your race - or at least thats what you think. Whether anyone else believes you is hardly relevant.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Minor Delusion: Derro Noble
sheet.description: You are a highborn of Derro nobility, or so you think. Whether others agree is irrelevant.

element.name: 31-40 : Has less power than actually does

description.p: You believe your powers insignificant, and constantly underestimate yourself. Despite the encouragement or factual accounts of others, you continue to feel despondent.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Minor Delusion: Underpowered
sheet.description: You believe your powers inferior to reality. The opinions of others have little effect in changing this belief.

element.name: 41-50 : Has more power than actually does

description.p: You believe that your powers surpass that of which you are actually capable. The reality that you are not as powerful as you think often lands you in concerning situations.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Minor Delusion: Overpowered
sheet.description: You believe you have more power than reality would suggest. Others notice, but you are heedless.

description.p: You are destined for greatness. You may not know for what, or when, but its coming, and it's your life's mission to seek it out, whatever the cost. You and your DM can define what shape this destiny takes for you in your campaign.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Minor Delusion: Important Destiny
sheet.description: You have an important destiny, toward which you are driven every day until you find it.

element.name: 61-70 : Believes a particular inanimate object is alive

description.p: You believe a particular inanimate object is alive. Choose one from the list.

element.name: 71-80 : Is a powerful creature polymorphed as a derro

description.p: You believe that derro is not what it seems. Surely it's a dragon in derro form, or some extraplanar being disguised? What manner of hellspawn has come to inflitrate the clan!?

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Minor Delusion: Polymorphed as a derro
sheet.description: That derro is not what it seems. It is not a derro, but what is it!?

element.name: 81-90 : Is commanded by voices speaking random gibberish and commands

description.p: You are commanded by voices from within, which speak in random gibberish most of the time, unless issuing you with another command. Whether you choose to follow is not entirely certain.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Minor Delusion: Commanding Voices
sheet.description: Voices issue commands intertwined with random gibberish. Whether to follow or not is uncertain.

element.name: 91-00 : Random patterns of either inanimate objects or living things have an important meaning and must be studied

description.p: You notice patterns where there are none, and these must be studied - special meaning can be derived, and you must know what it is!
For some inexplicable and totally irrational reason, you hold a deep-rooted prejudice against tiny insects, slugs or worms.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Irrational Prejudice: Tiny insect, slug, or worm
sheet.description: For some inexplicable and totally irrational reason, you hold a deep-rooted prejudice against one of the above creatures.

element.name: 71-80 : Rat, wolf, mole, badger, or other mammalian beast

description.p: You are absolutely, completely, all-encompassingly obsessed with rats, wolves, moles, badgers, or other mammalian beasts.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Obsession: Rat, wolf, mole, badger, or other mammalian beast
sheet.description: You are absolutely, completely, all-encompassingly obsessed with one of the above creatures.

description.p: You are absolutely, completely, all-encompassingly obsessed with constructs or clockwork creatures.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Obsession: Rat, wolf, mole, badger, or other mammalian beast
sheet.description: You are absolutely, completely, all-encompassingly obsessed with one of the above creatures.

description.p: You are absolutely, completely, all-encompassingly obsessed with angels or fiends.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Obsession: Angel or fiend
sheet.description: You are absolutely, completely, all-encompassingly obsessed with either angels or fiends.

element.name: 01-10 : Leers and rolls eyes upon seeing a particular type of creature

description.p: Every time you see this particular creature, you are filled with disdain, rolling your eyes and leering. Select the type of creature.

select.name: Leers and rolls eyes upon seeing a creature

element.name: 11-20 : Tic or tremor in body part

description.p: You have a randomly occurring and uncontrollable tic or tremor that manifests visibly in a part of your body.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Tic or tremor in body part
sheet.description: You have a randomly occurring and uncontrollable tic or tremor that manifests visibly in a part of your body.

element.name: 21-30 : Mutters constantly to self, sometimes narrating actions or feelings

description.p: You mutter incessantly under your breath, talking to yourself. Often it is nothing but mad babble, but sometimes you narrate your current actions, feelings, or inner monologue, externalised.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Mutters constantly to self
sheet.description: You mutter incessantly under your breath to yourself, babbling mindlessly, or narrating your actions or feelings.

element.name: 31-40 : Speaks inappropriate but true facts during diplomatic situations

description.p: You have the rather awkward habit of uttering inappropriate facts during diplomatic situations, causing all manner of difficulties for those around you.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Inappropriate facts
sheet.description: You have the tendency to tell the truth, even when it would be more auspicious to lie, such as during diplomacy.

element.name: 41-50 : Randomly speaks a word (chosen by GM) during combat or negotiation

description.p: During combat or negotiations, you will habitually utter the same word (chosen by the GM), over and over, regardless of the consequences.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Randomly speaks a word during combat or negotiation
sheet.description: You constantly mutter the same word over and over again during combat or negotiations, no matter how awkward, unsafe or inappropriate.

description.p: You tend to laugh at the worst possible times. It's incredibly inappropriate, and others have no problem telling you this. You know it isn't necessarily funny, but does that even matter?

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Laughs at inappropriate moments
sheet.description: You tend to laugh at the worst possible times. It doesn't matter whether it's funny or not; humour has little to do with it.

description.p: Whether something is tragic and sad, or happy and exciting, or downright infuriating, it's all the same: you have a tendency to weep at the most inappropriate of times, and it makes everyone uncomfortable.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Weeps at inappropriate moments
sheet.description: You tend to weep at the worst possible times. It doesn't matter whether it's tragic or not; circumstances have little to do with it.

description.p: Some do it out of anxiety. Some do it in frustration. Some do it to assuage homicidal rage. You haven't quite figured out which it is for you, you just do it all the time.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Constantly clenches and unclenches hands
sheet.description: Is it anxiety? Frustration? Rage? Doesn't matter, your hands are moving anyway.

description.p: While not enough to impact your movement or physical abilities to any great degree, anyone can see that you are, in fact, a hunchback.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Minor Hunchback
sheet.description: While not enough to impact your movement or physical abilities to any great degree, anyone can see that you are, in fact, a hunchback.

description.p: Half of your face is completely paralysed. Nothing you do will make it move in any way. It is an expressionless, unfeeling mask of flesh. You can decide whether it is the top half, bottom half, left or right side, and what exactly this looks like.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Facial Semi-paralysis
sheet.description: Half of your face is completely paralysed, an expressionless, unfeeling mask of flesh.

description.p: You have an unexplainable urge to collect rocks or crystals of all shapes, sizes and types.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Collector: Rocks or Crystals
sheet.description: Your madness drives you to collect rocks or crystals of all shapes, sizes and types

element.name: Bones, Hair, Nails or Bugs (Dead or Alive)

description.p: You collect all kinds of clippings, cuttings or bones from various creatures, or a bug specimens (whether dead or alive).

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Collector: Bones, Hair, Nails or Bugs (Dead or Alive)
sheet.description: You collect all kinds of clippings, cuttings or bones from various creatures, or a bug specimens (whether dead or alive).

element.name: Deodands (items responsible for the death of a creature)

description.p: Your fascination with death and its many forms have driven you to collect items that have caused death as mementos of the event.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Collector: Deodands
sheet.description: Your fascination with death and its many forms have driven you to collect the items responsible as mementos.

element.name: Eyes, fingers, teeth, ears, toes, or other small body parts

description.p: You take sick enjoyment in collecting trophies of the fallen in the form of various small body parts.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Collector: Eyes, fingers, teeth, ears, toes, or other small body parts
sheet.description: You take sick enjoyment in collecting trophies of the fallen in the form of various small body parts.

description.p: You are driven to collect various samples of dirt, dust or clay from any unusual place you visit.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Collector: Dirt, dust, or clay
sheet.description: You are driven to collect various samples of dirt, dust or clay from any unusual place you visit.

description.p: You tend to accumulate bits of rags or cloths or scraps of paper. Most think they're useless, but that's not why you do it, really.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Collector: Rags, cloths, or papers
sheet.description: You tend to accumulate bits of rags or cloths or scraps of paper. Most think they're useless, but that's not why you do it, really.

element.name: Hats, socks, gloves, or other clothing

description.p: You tend to accumulate random clothing items. It may be a particular type of item, or clothes in general, and nobody else can figure out why.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Collector: Hats, socks, gloves, or other clothing
sheet.description: You tend to accumulate random clothing items. It may be a particular type of item, or clothes in general, and nobody else can figure out why.

description.p: For whatever reason, things that bind other things enchant you. You collect pieces of string, bits of wire or lengths of chain with a rabid determination.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Collector: String, wire, or chain
sheet.description: For whatever reason, things that bind other things enchant you. You collect pieces of string, bits of wire or lengths of chain with a rabid determination.

description.p: Mechanisms, shinies, fasteners - they're just fascinating, right? You collect clockwork parts, jewelry or buttons with a drive second to none.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Collector: Clockwork parts, jewelry, or buttons
sheet.description: You collect clockwork parts, jewelry or buttons with a drive second to none.

element.name: Holy symbols, religious goods, or sacred texts

description.p: Prayer beads, statuettes, icons, when it comes to religious paraphernalia, you can't get enough. You've ammassed a sizeable collection, but you're nowhere near "done".

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Collector: Holy symbols, religious goods, or sacred texts
sheet.description: Prayer beads, statuettes, icons, when it comes to religious paraphernalia, you can't get enough. You've ammassed a sizeable collection, but you're nowhere near "done".

description.p: You have an unexplainable urge to eat rocks or crystals of all shapes, sizes and types.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Pica: Rocks or Crystals
sheet.description: Your madness drives you to eat rocks or crystals of all shapes, sizes and types

element.name: Bones, Hair, Nails or Bugs (Dead or Alive)

description.p: You have an uncontrollable urge to eat the bones, hair or nails of various creatures, or bugs whether dead or alive.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Pica: Bones, Hair, Nails or Bugs (Dead or Alive)
sheet.description: You have a penchant to eat bones, nail, hair or bugs (whether dead or alive) when and wherever you find them.

element.name: Deodands (items responsible for the death of a creature)

description.p: Your fascination with death and its many forms have driven you to eat items that have caused death.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Pica: Deodands
sheet.description: Your fascination with death and its many forms have driven you to eat the items responsible.

element.name: Eyes, fingers, teeth, ears, toes, or other small body parts

description.p: You take trophies of the fallen in the form of various small body parts, which you then are driven to eat at one time or another.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Pica: Eyes, fingers, teeth, ears, toes, or other small body parts
sheet.description: You take trophies of the fallen in the form of various small body parts and then sooner or later end up eating them.

description.p: You have a habit of eating various samples of dirt, dust or clay from any unusual place you visit.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Pica: Dirt, dust, or clay
sheet.description: You have a habit of eating various samples of dirt, dust or clay from any unusual place you visit.

description.p: Fibres... mmmm yummy! Anything fibrous - rags, cloth, paper - doesn't matter. It all has such a delicious mouthfeel, you can't resist.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Pica: Rags, cloths, or papers
sheet.description: Fibres... mmmm yummy! Anything fibrous - rags, cloth, paper - doesn't matter. It all has such a delicious mouthfeel, you can't resist.

element.name: Hats, socks, gloves, or other clothing

description.p: You don't know why you do it, but various items of clothing just look so damn tasty! They simply MUST get in your belly. Now. Or else...

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Pica: Hats, socks, gloves, or other clothing
sheet.description: You habitually and inexplicably eat various items of clothing.

description.p: For whatever reason, things that bind other things look appetising. You eat pieces of string, bits of wire or lengths of chain, regardless of what it does to you.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Pica: String, wire, or chain
sheet.description: For whatever reason, things that bind other things look appetising. You eat pieces of string, bits of wire or lengths of chain, regardless of what it does to you.

description.p: Mechanisms, shinies, fasteners - they're just fascinating, right? You feel the need to eat clockwork parts, jewelry or buttons with a drive second to none.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Pica: Clockwork parts, jewelry, or buttons
sheet.description: You feel the need to eat clockwork parts, jewelry or buttons with a drive second to none.

element.name: Holy symbols, religious goods, or sacred texts

description.p: Prayer beads, statuettes, icons, when it comes to religious paraphernalia, you can't get enough. You're ravenous for religious objects of all kinds, and scarf them down, however difficult.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Pica: Holy symbols, religious goods, or sacred texts
sheet.description: Prayer beads, statuettes, icons, when it comes to religious paraphernalia, you can't get enough. You're ravenous for religious objects of all kinds, and scarf them down, however difficult.

description.p: Whether a specimen in your possession, or the very rocks and crystals you pass by in the world, you're convinced at least one is a living sentient creature.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Living Inanimate Object: Rocks or Crystals
sheet.description: You believe a rock or crystal to be alive.

description.p: There's something... icky about the bones, hair and nails of creatures. Something about them just feels... alive, right?

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Living Inanimate Object: Bones, Hair, or Nails
sheet.description: You believe a particular bone, lock of hair or nail clipping is alive when logically it is an inanimate object.

element.name: 21-30 Deodands (items responsible for the death of a creature)

description.p: Your fascination with death and its many forms have convinced you that items causing death can sometimes become alive themselves. You percieve one such item.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Living Inanimate Object: Deodands
sheet.description: You perceive an item responsible for a death you are aware of as a living entity.

element.name: 31-40 Eyes, fingers, teeth, ears, toes, or other small body parts

description.p: Eyes, fingers, teeth, ears, toes - these are all things one would expect to die when removed from their original host. Not so with this one particular item, which you are absolutely convinced is alive.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Living Inanimate Object: Eyes, fingers, teeth, ears, toes, or other small body parts
sheet.description: Eyes, fingers, teeth, ears, toes - these are all things one would expect to die when removed from their original host. Not so with this one particular item, which you are absolutely convinced is alive.

description.p: It shouldn't be possible, but somehow that patch of sediment, sample of grit or lump of slurry is most definitely alive...

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Living Inanimate Object: Dirt, dust, or clay
sheet.description: It shouldn't be possible, but somehow that patch of sediment, sample of grit or lump of slurry is most definitely alive...

description.p: You've heard of Raggedy Ann, a flying carpet, and an animated piece of paper that's supposed to help you write - but have you seen this!?

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Living Inanimate Object: Rags, cloths, or papers
sheet.description: You've heard of Raggedy Ann, a flying carpet, and an animated piece of paper that's supposed to help you write - but have you seen this!?

element.name: 61-70 Hats, socks, gloves, or other clothing

description.p: This ain't no Sorting Hat or Thing, but it's definitely alive. Why is it nobody else notices?

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Living Inanimate Object: Hats, socks, gloves, or other clothing
sheet.description: This ain't no Sorting Hat or Thing, but it's definitely alive. Why is it nobody else notices?

description.p: You're not sure what strange magicks are afoot, but that length of material is definitely alive...

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Living Inanimate Object: String, wire, or chain
sheet.description: You're not sure what strange magicks are afoot, but that length of material is definitely alive...

description.p: Clockwork parts might move on their own, but only for the purpose they were made, not like this... That bracelet, is it talking to me? The buttons on that man's coat - they're definitely alive!

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Living Inanimate Object: Clockwork parts, jewelry, or buttons
sheet.description: You feel that a certain clockwork object, piece of jewelry or button is alive.

element.name: 91-00 Holy symbols, religious goods, or sacred texts

description.p: Religious iconography is meant to spark remembrance in believers, bring them to the faith. How much faith does it take to bring one to life such as that!?

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Living Inanimate Object: Holy symbols, religious goods, or sacred texts
sheet.description: Religious iconography is meant to spark remembrance in believers, bring them to the faith. How much faith does it take to bring one to life such as that!?

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Rocks or Crystals
sheet.description: Where others see random rocky outcrops and crystal formations, you see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

element.name: 11-20 Bones, Hair, Nails, or Bugs (Dead or Alive)

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Bones, Hair, Nails, or Bugs (Dead or Alive)
sheet.description: Where others see random bones, tufts of hair, nail clippings or bugs, you see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

element.name: 21-30 Deodands (items responsible for the death of a creature)

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Deodands
sheet.description: Where others see objects of death and misery, you see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

element.name: 31-40 Eyes, fingers, teeth, ears, toes, or other small body parts

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Eyes, fingers, teeth, ears, toes, or other small body parts
sheet.description: Some might see random body parts. You see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Dirt, dust, or clay
sheet.description: Where others see random dirt, inconspicuous dust or insignificant clay deposits, you see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Rags, cloths, or papers
sheet.description: Instead of a pile of rags, castaway cloths or random scraps of paper, you see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

element.name: 61-70 Hats, socks, gloves, or other clothing

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Hats, socks, gloves, or other clothing
sheet.description: To some, it's just fashion choices, the clothes people wear - but you see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: String, wire, or chain
sheet.description: Where others see tools of binding and joining - functional, useful, mundane - you see snaking patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Clockwork parts, jewelry, or buttons
sheet.description: The intricate workings of clockwork aparatus, the fine craftsmanship of jewelry, the mundane fixings of buttons - nondescript to most, but to you, puzzles that must be studied to unlock their hidden meanings.

element.name: 91-00 Holy symbols, religious goods, or sacred texts

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Holy symbols, religious goods, or sacred texts
sheet.description: Religious iconography is often laden with meaning, but the patterns you see hold unique significance, worthy of study to excavate the deepest of hidden understandings.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Tiny insect, slug or worm
sheet.description: Others may recoil in revulsion or phobic anxiety, but in the movements of these tiny creatures you see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

element.name: 11-20 Chicken, cat, dog, sheep, cow, or other domestic animal (pick a type)

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Chicken, cat, dog, sheep, cow, or other domestic animal
sheet.description: You see patterns of great import in these mundane creatures - patterns nobody else notices - that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

element.name: 21-30 Elf, dwarf, human, kobold, or other humanoid

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Elf, dwarf, human, kobold, or other humanoid
sheet.description: In these common intelligent races, so sane and ordinary, you see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

element.name: 31-40 Rat, giant centipede, gelatinous cube, or other giant vermin or ooze (pick a type)

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Rat, giant centipede, gelatinous cube, or other giant vermin or ooze
sheet.description: In these pesky denizens of underground and hidden spaces you see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Cleric or druid
sheet.description: The clergy of the new faiths and those who follow the Old Faith are fascinating to you - the patterns you see in them must be studied for their hidden meanings.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Wizard or sorcerer
sheet.description: Whether study of musty tomes and records or innate spellcasting abilities, the intricacies of arcanists present you with patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

element.name: 61-70 Sparrow, pigeon, hawk, owl, or other bird

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Sparrow, pigeon, hawk, owl, or other bird
sheet.description: In the lives and habits of various avian species you see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

element.name: 71-80 Rat, wolf, mole, badger, or other mammalian beast

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Rat, wolf, mole, badger, or other mammalian beast
sheet.description: In the lives and habits of various mammalian beasts you see patterns of great import that must be studied for their hidden meanings.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Construct or clockwork creature
sheet.description: The unannatural animation, the intricate inner workings - puzzles that must be studied to unlock their hidden meanings.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Delusion: Important Patterns: Angel or fiend
sheet.description: Whether studying those of the higher planes or those of the lower, the patterns you find simply must be studied to understand their hidden meanings.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Leer/Eye Roll: Tiny insect, slug or worm
sheet.description: The sight, or even thought of these tiny little creepers fills you with a visible eye-rolling disdain.

element.name: 11-20 Chicken, cat, dog, sheep, cow, or other domestic animal (pick a type)

sheet.description: The sight, or even thought of these mundane creatures fills you with a visible eye-rolling disdain.

element.name: 31-40 Rat, giant centipede, gelatinous cube, or other giant vermin or ooze (pick a type)

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Leer/Eye Roll: Rat, giant centipede, gelatinous cube, or other giant vermin or ooze

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Leer/Eye Roll: Cleric or druid
sheet.description: The sight, or even thought of the clergy of the new faiths and those who follow the Old Faith fills you with a visible eye-rolling disdain.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Leer/Eye Roll: Wizard or sorcerer
sheet.description: The sight, or even thought of these arcane poractitioners fills you with a visible eye-rolling disdain.

element.name: 61-70 Sparrow, pigeon, hawk, owl, or other bird

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Leer/Eye Roll: Sparrow, pigeon, hawk, owl, or other bird
sheet.description: The sight, or even thought of various avian species fills you with a visible eye-rolling disdain.

element.name: 71-80 Rat, wolf, mole, badger, or other mammalian beast

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Leer/Eye Roll: Rat, wolf, mole, badger, or other mammalian beast
sheet.description: The sight, or even thought of various mammalian beasts fills you with a visible eye-rolling disdain.

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Leer/Eye Roll: Construct or clockwork creature

sheet.alt: Minor Madness: Physical Effect: Leer/Eye Roll: Angel or fiend

description.p: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws against spells.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws against spells.

description.p: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

sheet.description: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

description.p: Derro differ based on their location within derro communities, their clan’s connections to the dark powers that sculpt and manipulate the derro race, and the manifestations of the changes their otherworldly patrons bestow on them. Most derro dwell happily and deeply in their culture-induced insanity for their entire existence, others escape the madness-inducing indoctrination, and others still go straight through the madness toward powers beyond what derro usually enjoy.

You grew up firmly ensconced in the mad traditions of the derro, your mind touched by the raw majesty and power of your society’s otherworldly deities. Your abilities in other areas have made you more than a typical derro, of course. But no matter how well-trained and skilled you get in other magical or martial arts, the voices of your gods forever reverberate in your ears, driving you forward to do great or terrible things.
Ability Score Increase. Your Charisma score increases by 1.

Insanity. You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. In addition, you can read and understand Void Speech, but you can speak only a few words of the dangerous and maddening language—the words necessary for using the spells in your Mad Fervor trait.

Mad Fervour. The driving force behind your insanity has blessed you with a measure of its power. You know the vicious mockery cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the enthrall spell with this trait, and starting at 5th level, you can cast the fear spell with it. Once you cast a non-cantrip spell with this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells. If you are using Deep Magic for 5th Edition, these spells are instead crushing curse, maddening whispers, and alone, respectively.

You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. In addition, you can read and understand Void Speech, but you can speak only a few words of the dangerous and maddening language—the words necessary for using the spells in your Mad Fervor trait.

sheet.description: You have advantage against being charmed or frightened. You can read and understand Void Speech, but can only speak enough to use Mad Fervor.

description.p: The driving force behind your insanity has blessed you with a measure of its power. You know the vicious mockery cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the enthrall spell with this trait, and starting at 5th level, you can cast the fear spell with it. Once you cast a non-cantrip spell with this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells. If you are using Deep Magic for 5th Edition, these spells are instead crushing curse, maddening whispers, and alone, respectively.

The driving force behind your insanity has blessed you with a measure of its power. You know the vicious mockery cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the enthrall spell with this trait, and starting at 5th level, you can cast the fear spell with it. Once you cast a non-cantrip spell with this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

sheet.description: You know the Vicious Mockery cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.
You know the Vicious Mockery cantrip. You can cast the Enthrall spell once per long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
You know the Vicious Mockery cantrip. You can cast the Enthrall or Fear spells once per long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

description.p: The driving force behind your insanity has blessed you with a measure of its power. Since you are using Deep Magic for 5th Edition, you know the crushing curseDMVM cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the maddening whispersDMVM spell with this trait, and starting at 5th level, you can cast the aloneDMVM spell with it. Once you cast a non-cantrip spell with this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

sheet.description: You know the Crushing Curse cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.
You know the Crushing Curse cantrip. You can cast the Maddening Whispers spell once per long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
You know the Crushing Cursey cantrip. You can cast the Maddening Whispers or Alone spells once per long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

description.p: You cause a creature within range to believe its allies have been banished to a different realm. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it treats its allies as if they were invisible and silenced. The affected creature cannot target, perceive, or otherwise interact with its allies for the duration of the spell. If one of its allies hits it with a melee attack, the affected creature can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Most derro go through the process of indoctrination into their society and come out of it with visions and delusion, paranoia and mania. You, on the other hand, were not affected as much mentally as you were physically. The connection to the dark deities of your people made you stronger and gave you a physical manifestation of their gift that other derro look upon with envy and awe.
Ability Score Increase. Your Strength score increases by 1.
Athletic Training. You have proficiency in the Athletics skill, and you are proficient with two martial weapons of your choice.

Otherworldly Influence. Your close connection to the strange powers that your people worship has mutated your form. Choose one of the following:
Alien Appendage. You have a tentacle-like growth on your body. This tentacle is a natural melee weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with it, your tentacle deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. This tentacle has a reach of 5 feet and can lift a number of pounds equal to double your Strength score. The tentacle can’t wield weapons or shields or perform tasks that require manual precision, such as performing the somatic components of a spell, but it can perform simple tasks, such as opening an unlocked door or container, stowing or retrieving an object, or pouring the contents out of a vial.
Tainted Blood. Your blood is tainted by your connection with otherworldly entities. When you take piercing or slashing damage, you can use your reaction to force your blood to spray out of the wound. You and each creature within 5 feet of you take necrotic damage equal to your level. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Tenebrous Flesh. Your skin is rubbery and tenebrous, granting you a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.
You have proficiency in the Athletics skill, and you are proficient with two martial weapons of your choice.
Your close connection to the strange powers that your people worship has mutated your form.

sheet.description: Your close connection to the strange powers that your people worship has mutated your form.

description.p: You have a tentacle-like growth on your body. This tentacle is a natural melee weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with it, your tentacle deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. This tentacle has a reach of 5 feet and can lift a number of pounds equal to double your Strength score. The tentacle can’t wield weapons or shields or perform tasks that require manual precision, such as performing the somatic components of a spell, but it can perform simple tasks, such as opening an unlocked door or container, stowing or retrieving an object, or pouring the contents out of a vial.

sheet.description: You have a tentacle that counts as a natural melee weapon for unarmed strikes (1d4 + {{strength:modifier}} bludgeoning damage), with 5 ft reach and it can lift {{tentacle lift}} lbs. It cannot use weapons or shields, or cast spells, but can perform simple tasks such as opening a door or container, stow or retrieve an object or pour a vial.

description.p: Your blood is tainted by your connection with otherworldly entities. When you take piercing or slashing damage, you can use your reaction to force your blood to spray out of the wound. You and each creature within 5 feet of you take necrotic damage equal to your level. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When you take piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet takes {{level}} necrotic damage.

description.p: Your skin is rubbery and tenebrous, granting you a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

sheet.description: Your skin is rubbery and tenebrous, granting you a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

description.p: Someone in your past failed to do their job of driving you to the brink of insanity. It might have been a doting parent that decided to buck tradition. It might have been a touched seer who had visions of your future without the connections to the mad gods your people serve. It might have been a whole outcast community of derro rebels who refused to serve the madness of your ancestors. Whatever happened in your past, you are quite sane—or at least quite sane for a derro.
Ability Score Increase. Your Wisdom score increases by 1
Extra Language. You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choice.

Psychic Barrier. Your time among your less sane brethren has inured you to their madness. You have resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against effects that inflict insanity, such as spells like contact other plane and symbol, and effects that cause short‑term, long-term, or indefinite madness.

Studied Insight. You are skilled at discerning other creature’s motives and intentions. You have proficiency in the Insight skill, and, if you study a creature for at least 1 minute, you have advantage on any initiative checks in combat against that creature for the next hour.

Your time among your less sane brethren has inured you to their madness. You have resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against effects that inflict insanity, such as spells like Contact Other Plane and Symbol, and effects that cause short‑term, long-term, or indefinite madness.

sheet.description: You have advantage against effects or spells that inflict short-term, long-term, or indefinite insanity.

description.p: You are skilled at discerning other creature’s motives and intentions. You have proficiency in the Insight skill, and, if you study a creature for at least 1 minute, you have advantage on any initiative checks in combat against that creature for the next hour.

sheet.description: If you study a creature for at least 1 minute, you have advantage on initiative checks against it in combat for the next hour.
